title: David Gilmour - 2016-03-31 - Air Canada Centre, Toronto, ON
description:
Here is a nice bootleg. Check my account for more classic bootlegs.

Please enjoy, share with friends and please seed :)

David Gilmour 3/31/2016
Air Canada Centre - Toronto, ON
Recorded by jmr
Source: Floor right, row 28 -> Zoom H1 (24/48)-> Adobe Audition 3.0 (EQ, levels, edits) -> Foobar2000 -> FLAC

Set 1:
1. 5 A.M.
2. Rattle That Lock
3. Faces of Stone
4. Wish You Were Here
5. What Do You Want From Me
6. A Boat Lies Waiting
7. The Blue
8. Money
9. Us and Them
10. In Any Tongue
11. High Hopes

Set 2:
1. Astronomy Domine
2. Shine On You Crazy Diamond (Parts I-V)
3. Fat Old Sun
4. Coming Back to Life
5. Band Introductions
6. The Girl in the Yellow Dress
7. Today
8. Sorrow
9. Run Like Hell
10. Encore break
11. Time
12. Comfortably Numb

Recorder notes:
This was supposed to be the "grand debut" of my new recording setup. I custom-built a set of microphones using high-grade electret mics, coaxial cable, etc, and a battery box to go along with it. I went with the mics safety-pinned inside my collar. However, I messed up: the gain on my recorder is way too hot and the recording is marred with so much digital clipping that it's hardly listenable. Didn't catch that during my limiting testing (I only finished building the battery box the morning of the concert.) F**k. Back to the drawing board.

Since this was the first time I was to use the new mics, and I didn't want to risk missing catching this show, I had a Zoom H1 recorder running as a backup. This is that backup. Unfortunatly, because the people in front of me couldn't decide to sit or stand (you can hear a "sit the f**k down!" from some of the people nearby) there was some shuffling and the recorder got knocked around a tiny bit during the first two songs. Aside from that, I'm pretty happy with how this turned out. 

This was my first time seeing any member of Pink Floyd perform.  :D
